The understanding about family

When it is possible to be together in our family in daily basis, it looks like that we are in front of a solid, and well-defined concept, but as Kathleen Gough observes, nobody knows exactly when families were created. Probably it happened around "two million and 100,000 years ago" (Gough, Kathleen, 1971, 760). The definition also needed time to happen, as it is shown in a study about Frederick Engels' work (Engels, Frederick, 1944):

  • Until the year of 1860, there was not any study about the history of the family, the sciences were still accepting the ideas from Pentateuch (Engels, Frederick, 1988, 708 ; Torah, Neviim u-Khetuvim. Twenty-four books of the Holy Scriptures carefully translated according to the Massoretic text, on the basis of the English version, after the best Jewish authorities, 1891, pp. 1 - 254 ).
  • Among the American Indigenous, the African people and also the Australian people, there was a "kinship" system, and when he studied deeper, he arrived in the conclusion that before a patriarchal society, there as a matriarchal society (Engels, Frederick, 1988, 709, 710 ; Engels, Frederick, 1944, pp. 91)
  • According to Morgan, there were four different types of families created by our specie (Engels, Frederick, 1988, pp. 712 - 719).
  • About the monogamy, we would like to highlight: it was not made by sex love, or natural events, instead, it was made by economic reasons; The Roman people had a better treatment of women, when compared with Greek people, but the system only reached another level with the Germanic people; there was no marriage by love before the European Middle Ages (Engels, Frederick, 1988, pp. 719 - 729).

Frederick Engels mention three social levels for our specie (Engels, Frederick, 1944, pp. 19 - 25). When he talks about Iroquis Indigenous, he mentionss they were still living like a primitive family, like the ancient Greek and Romans, and this was "common to all barbarians until their entry into civilization" (Engels, Frederick, 1944, pp. 86, 101 - 102). This affirmation has some issues, because we cannot consider a superior people, we only have different ways of thinking (History Tracers, 2024), obviously there are different barbarian actions, that are not associated with this text context, for this reason, we won't mentions them. Another example where women have an important role in family structure, and we probably have kinship relationship is the Inca Empire (History Tracers, 2024 ; Poma de Ayala, Felipe Gusmán, 1615, pp. 121 - 140).

Reflection 1: About families
In the work studying Frederick Engels (Engels, Frederick, 1988), we are presented to four different kind of families. How many kinds of families did you know?
 

In a recent paper, Sergio Reuben Soto expose our knowledge about the evolution of our concept of family, he works with the impact of different relationships on the Homo sapiens, and he arrived in the conclusion that the modern society on familiar nucleus (father, mother and children), bringing a different conclusion of common sense (Soto, Sergio R., 2006).

A group named family

Our study shows that since the beginning of the universe, we have quantities that are grouped. Following this logic, we also can consider families as a group of people, independent of the family mode that we are working (Engels, Frederick, 1988, pp. 712 - 719).

Let us start choosing some Christian families, like their documents show, so these families are monogamous (Engels, Frederick, 1988, pp. 719 - 729) having father, mother and son/daughter:

  • The Fernão Dias Paes's family is formed by: Fernão Dias Paes (son; 1), Pedro Dias (father; 2) and Maria Leite da Silva (mother; 3) (History Tracers, 2023). We also study some brothers of him, but to make the study simpler, we are not considering them now.
  • The Pedro Dias' family, his father, has the following people: Pedro Dias (son; 2), Fernão Dias (father; 4), and Lucrécia Leme (mother; 5) (History Tracers, 2024).
  • Finally, the family of Maria Leite da Silva, his mother, is formed by: Maria Leite da Silva (daughter; 3), Paschoal Leite (father; 6), and Izabel do Prado (mother; 7) (History Tracers, 2024).

Using these families, lets us do some simplifications, that will do these families equal other families, without any model, so the families connections are made either when a baby was born, or when we have feelings:

  • We are going to name Fernão Dias Paes' family as group F, and we are going to use the numbers attributed previously for the people to define their individuals: F = {1, 2, 3}
  • We are also going to do this for Pedro Dias' family, we are going to create the group P: P = {2, 4, 5}.
  • Finally, the family of Maria Leite da Silva will be defined as M: M = {3, 6, 7}.

Reflection 2: When we make abstraction
People were identified as numbers and they "lost" connections by paper. This also allowed us to generalize marking connections either when a birth happens, or when there are feelings. When we create abstraction, do we become more natural?
 

Before to add new knowledge, let us knowledge from text about writing system (History Tracers, 2024) to compare groups. It is possible to say that 2 ⊂ P (P contains 2), 3 ⊂ M (M contains 3), and 2,3 ⊂ P (F contains 2 and 3). Another way, most common, it is saying that a person belongs (∈) to a family, for example, Pedro Dias belongs to Fernão Dias Paes' family, or in a mathematic way Pedro Dias ∈ to Fernão Dias Paes' family. We can also write in an abstract form 2 ∈ F.

When we compare, we cannot do affirmation the groups are equal, this means they are different. Is there a mathematical way to write they are different groups? It was also made the symbol ≠ to say the groups are different, so we can write F ≠ P (F is different of P), F ≠ M (F is different of M), e M ≠ P (M is different of P).

When we only compare groups, this is not enough to define all ancestors of a person, we need another way to do the small families, nuclear families, to be a large group, something that can unite these groups, familiar groups. Using math, we define union as ∪, now we can group all families: we are going to name the families we are studying as group H, now uniting them, H = F ∪ P ∪ M, we have the group H defined as H = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7}. Pay attention that when groups are united, there is no number repetition.

Figure 1: Union among groups. The source code is available in GitHub of the project (History Tracers, 2024).

Is there a mathematical way to say people belong to different families? When a person belongs to different families, all these families are his own family. Using math, we can say that the families are subgroups of a large group, his family, or his ancestors. The confirmation of a person belongs to different families is done studying the group intersection representing by the symbol ∩. Let us do an example, when we do the intersection of groups F and P we have as result F ∩ P = {2}, when we take a look in these groups above, we can see Pedro Dias, father of Fernão Dias Paes, is in his son's family, group F, and we also can see his belongs to his parents' family, group P, as it is expected.

Figure 2: Intersection between groups. The source code is available in GitHub of the project (History Tracers, 2024).

Conclusion

When we work with families doing abstraction, this allows us to work with only one kind of family doing all people equal. This does not mean we cannot create other groups to understand the human society.

Questions

    Answer next questions:
  1. Is the study of families millennial? .
  2. Was the family model in América/Abya Yala different of monogamy? .
  3. Does Morgan mention four different family kind? .
  4. Did women have a major role in Indigenous families? .
  5. The families are not group, is this last sentence correct? .
  6. Is the union of groups N = {0, 1, 2} and M = {9, 8, 7} equal to the group K = {0, 1, 2, 9, 8}? .
  7. Is the subgroup P = {1, 2} part of group Q = { 1, 2, 3, 4}? .
  8. Is the family FF = {Fulano, Beltrano, Ciclano}, the same family AlphaBeta = {Alpha, Beta, Gama}? .
  9. Is the intersection of the groups U = {A, B, C, D} and V = { A, X, Z, D} equal to group X = {A, D}? .
